answers.answer: 78th percentile is not significantly large but is above average.  Did you have the testing done for gestational  diabetes yet?

If you test positive for diabetes, you will probably have one or two more possibly three ultrasounds for growth. Also, make sure they keep an eye on the baby's abdominal circumference as an overly large abdominal circumference is a sign of uncontrolled diabetes with mom and accelerated growth in the baby's torso. On the other hand, if you test negative for diabetes, you just might have a genetically destined big baby. If that were the case, the baby's growth parameters including the head, the belly, and the leg would probably all be symmetrically large. It is under the 10th percentile and over the 90th percentile that can become particularly worrisome.if the baby cruises along in the 70s percentiles, probably no worries. Good luck and keep us posted.
Mine tested in the 91st percentile 3weeks ago & they haven't done a thing. I have another ultrasound Monday (due on the 4th)
I'm curious as well. My doc is saying my son is in the 97th percentile in weight and growth. I'm pretty terrified that I'm going to be giving birth to a 12+ pound baby! Lol
Same here ha so confused about it

Being pregnant I have never been told what my kids were. At birth I know my son weighed 6 lbs 9oz and he was just under the fiftey percentile. Hes still small for his age but hes extremely smart and social and advanced quickly . My daughter was 7 lbs 3 oz and shes always been around 70-75 percentile and still is. Shes tall and skinny for her age but also very smart and advanced.

Tge percentile can vary drastically throughout your pregnancy do i wiukdbt be concerned. My lo was 34% and dropped to 9% within a couple of weeks. Each pregnancy is different and all bubs have growth spurts at different stages. Best of luck
